refnamediv.refpurpose: Converts a string containing an (IPv4) Internet Protocol dotted address into a proper address

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The function ip2long generates an IPv4 Internet network address from its Internet standard format (dotted string) representation. If ip_address is invalid then -1 is returned. Note that -1 does not evaluate as &false; in PHP.

note.para: As of PHP 5.0.0 ip2long returns &false; when ip_address is invalid.

example.title: ip2long Example
example.programlisting:
\n"; $out .= "http://www.example.com/, http://" . $ip . "/, and http://" . sprintf("%u", ip2long($ip)) . "/
\n"; echo $out; ?>

note.para: Because PHP's integer type is signed, and many IP addresses will result in negative integers, you need to use the "%u" formatter of sprintf or printf to get the string representation of the unsigned IP address.
ip2long will return -1 for the IP 255.255.255.255
